paragraphs.title: Verify Spark Version (should be 2.x)
paragraphs.text:
%spark2.spark

// verify the spark version

paragraphs.title: Download CSV Pokemon dataset
paragraphs.text:
%sh

#  Remove old dataset file if already exists in local /tmp directory
if [ -e /tmp/spark-ft/joey/pokemon.csv ]
then
    rm -f /tmp/spark-ft/joey/pokemon.csv
fi

# download the file https://raw.githubusercontent.com/joeyfaherty/datasets/master/kaggle/Pokemon.csv to /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/Pokemon.csv

msg.data:

paragraphs.title: Move dataset to HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# remove the file if it exists in HDFS at /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/Pokemon.csv


# copy the local file into hdfs to /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME


# verify that the file is present in HDFS

msg.data:
17/09/29 14:26:49 INFO fs.TrashPolicyDefault: Moved: 'hdfs://fasttrack1.kpn:8020/tmp/spark-ft/joey/Pokemon.csv' to trash at: hdfs://fasttrack1.kpn:8020/user/zeppelin/.Trash/Current/tmp/spark-ft/joey/Pokemon.csv
-rw-r--r--   1 zeppelin hdfs      44034 2017-09-29 14:26 /tmp/spark-ft/joey/Pokemon.csv

paragraphs.title: Create a DataFrame from CSV file

msg.data: pokemonDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [#: int, Name: string ... 11 more fields]

paragraphs.title: Print Schema
paragraphs.text:
%spark2.spark

// Print the schema in a tree format

msg.data:
root
 |-- #: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Name: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Type1: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Type2: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Total: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- HP: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Attack: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Defense: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Special_Atk: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Special_Def: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Speed: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Generation: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- Legendary: boolean (nullable = true)

paragraphs.title: Show a subset of columns
paragraphs.text:
%spark2.spark

// Show a subset of columns using pokemonDF.select(cols...)

paragraphs.title: Apply a filter to find pokemon with an attack higher than 175 points

msg.data:
highAttackDS: org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset[org.apache.spark.sql.Row] = [Name: string, Attack: int]
+--------------------+------+
|                Name|Attack|
+--------------------+------+
| MewtwoMega Mewtwo X|   190|
|HeracrossMega Her...|   185|
|GroudonPrimal Gro...|   180|
|RayquazaMega Rayq...|   180|
|  DeoxysAttack Forme|   180|
+--------------------+------+

paragraphs.title: Apply some more transformations using the Dataset API

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Part 2: Using SQL API to Analyze the Pokemon Data

msg.data: Part 2: Using SQL API to Analyze the Pokemon Data

paragraphs.title: Are you more familiar with writing SQL queries?
paragraphs.text:
%md

Let's create a temporary (in-memory) view that we can run SQL queries against and interact with the resulting data in a table or graph format. The temporary view will allow us to execute SQL queries against it.

Note that the temporary view will reside in memory as long as the Spark session is alive.

msg.data:
Let’s create a temporary (in-memory) view that we can run SQL queries against and interact with the resulting data in a table or graph format. The temporary view will allow us to execute SQL queries against it.

Note that the temporary view will reside in memory as long as the Spark session is alive.

paragraphs.title: Register a Temporary View

msg.data: myName: String = joey

paragraphs.title: Direct SQL queries
paragraphs.text:
%spark2.spark

// use spark.sql(stmnt) to perform a direct sql query

msg.data:
+--------------------+-------+-----+---------+
|                Name|  Type1|Total|Legendary|
+--------------------+-------+-----+---------+
| MewtwoMega Mewtwo X|Psychic|  780|     true|
| MewtwoMega Mewtwo Y|Psychic|  780|     true|
|RayquazaMega Rayq...| Dragon|  780|     true|
| KyogrePrimal Kyogre|  Water|  770|     true|
|GroudonPrimal Gro...| Ground|  770|     true|
|              Arceus| Normal|  720|     true|
|TyranitarMega Tyr...|   Rock|  700|    false|
|SalamenceMega Sal...| Dragon|  700|    false|
|MetagrossMega Met...|  Steel|  700|    false|
|   LatiasMega Latias| Dragon|  700|     true|
|   LatiosMega Latios| Dragon|  700|     true|
|GarchompMega Garc...| Dragon|  700|    false|
|  KyuremBlack Kyurem| Dragon|  700|     true|
|  KyuremWhite Kyurem| Dragon|  700|     true|
| DiancieMega Diancie|   Rock|  700|     true|
|              Mewtwo|Psychic|  680|     true|

|               Ho-oh|   Fire|  680|     true|
|            Rayquaza| Dragon|  680|     true|
|              Dialga|  Steel|  680|     true|
+--------------------+-------+-----+---------+
only showing top 20 rows

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Persisting Results / Data

Finally, let's persist some of our results by saving our DataFrames in a columnar file format called Parquet.

msg.data:
Persisting Results / Data

Finally, let’s persist some of our results by saving our DataFrames in a columnar file format called Parquet.

paragraphs.text:
%angular

Various Save Modes

Mode (Scala/Java) Meaning
SaveMode.ErrorIfExists (default) When saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data already exists, an exception is expected to be thrown.
SaveMode.Append When saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data/table already exists, contents of the DataFrame are expected to be appended to existing data.
SaveMode.Overwrite Overwrite mode means that when saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data/table already exists, existing data is expected to be overwritten by the contents of the DataFrame.
SaveMode.Ignore Ignore mode means that when saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data already exists, the save operation is expected to not save the contents of the DataFrame and to not change the existing data. This is similar to a CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS in SQL.

Note: Save operations can optionally take a SaveMode, that specifies how to handle existing data if present. It is important to realize that these save modes do not utilize any locking and are not atomic. Additionally, when performing an Overwrite, the data will be deleted before writing out the new data.

msg.data:
Various Save Modes

Mode (Scala/Java) Meaning
SaveMode.ErrorIfExists (default) When saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data already exists, an exception is expected to be thrown.
SaveMode.Append When saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data/table already exists, contents of the DataFrame are expected to be appended to existing data.
SaveMode.Overwrite Overwrite mode means that when saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data/table already exists, existing data is expected to be overwritten by the contents of the DataFrame.
SaveMode.Ignore Ignore mode means that when saving a DataFrame to a data source, if data already exists, the save operation is expected to not save the contents of the DataFrame and to not change the existing data. This is similar to a CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS in SQL.

Note: Save operations can optionally take a SaveMode, that specifies how to handle existing data if present. It is important to realize that these save modes do not utilize any locking and are not atomic. Additionally, when performing an Overwrite, the data will be deleted before writing out the new data.

paragraphs.title: Save to Parquet file

msg.data: import org.apache.spark.sql.SaveMode

paragraphs.title: Validate your parquet file is in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# do an ls on the path in HDFS where you just wrote the parquet table in the above step

msg.data:
Found 2 items
-rw-r--r--   1 zeppelin hdfs          0 2017-09-29 14:30 /tmp/spark-ft/joey/parquet/_SUCCESS
-rw-r--r--   1 zeppelin hdfs      22547 2017-09-29 14:30 /tmp/spark-ft/joey/parquet/part-00000-11a16794-8616-48b9-9236-f7a651d4c094.snappy.parquet

paragraphs.title: Load back from the parquet file in HDFS

msg.data: test: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [#: int, Name: string ... 11 more fields]

paragraphs.title: Use a partition when writing

msg.data: partitionColumn: String = Type1

paragraphs.title: List the partitioned data in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# again, do an ls on the /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/parquet
# we will now see the partitioned data as you created in previous step
